title: Detecting and banning extreme Intentional Feeders
body:
Hey everyone,
 
As some of you may have heard, the Tribunal is a system that addresses many types of player behaviors but is currently in extended maintenance while we upgrade a lot of the core functionality. You can read more about it here: http://na.leagueoflegends.com/en/news/game-updates/player-behavior/upgrading-tribunal
 
In the meantime, we've launched several test systems that have begun aggressively reducing negative player behaviors in League of Legends including a system with the ability to instantly escalate high severity behaviors such as excessive verbal abuse, racism, sexism, homophobia and worse to a 14-day or permanent ban. After several weeks of testing in North America, we are now ready to start these tests on the European servers. We'll continue to monitor the results of these tests as we prepare to roll them out in other regions.
 
The reason I'm here today though, is because while these systems are effective at reducing *negative verbal behaviors* in League, we've been working on ways to address *negative gameplay behaviors* in League.
 
Starting 8/26/2014 in North America, weâ€™ll be rolling out a test system capable of immediately escalating extreme intentional feeders straight to a 14-day or permanent ban. Like our other punishment systems, weâ€™ll start with conservative tests to minimize false positives, and then expand the system to be more aggressive. As with our other experiments, depending on the results, weâ€™ll roll out similar tests to the other servers.

replies.body: How confident are you in the systems ability to discern between an intentional feeder, and a player on tilt?
Doesnt matter.
So anyone who has a terrible game playing a champion for the first time and goes 0-10, deserves to be permabanned?

We'd rarely (if ever) ban a player for having one poor game--we may ban a player if it's super, extremely obvious they were intentional feeding in one game. We have a huge dataset at our disposal and can clearly see what's typical for a game, and what's one, two, three standard deviations for a game. We can also determine how you normally play in one game with a brand new champion first how you play in another game with a brand new champion to determine how much of an outlier one of the matches were.

This makes sense. Another way to know is simply by seeing how many turret deaths they have! There should be a way to track that. 

Side note. Pantheon feeders jumping into turrets to feed, and other times pantheon plays could think they're strong enough to secure a squishy kill. i Witnessed this in ranked a few times. A pantheon feeder would drop on top of mid turret and TRY to get the kill, even though he never did. He kept typing stuff like Awww mann i tootallyyy almost gott himm!!!!11!!!.. So even though he intentionally fed and cost them the game, he did have like 8 kills and 22 deaths end game; How could you know it was intentional? (even though it was)

This is really the problem.  I've seen a few strait up intentional feeders who just strait up go 0/XX.

Most of the intentional feeders I've run into are much more ... cleaver about it to the point that it's often hard to be certain it's intentional at all.

Recently, for example, I had a player who announced in pre-game chat that they would feed and make us lose.  Once game started they went 0/6 using tp to feed every lane 2 kills.  This, obviously, made it very hard for mid and bot to win lane since they were down 600 gold by minute 5.

After that they started playing cleanup jumping into nearly ended fights to grab every kill they could (all our abilities being on cd and theirs being fresh) and then either die from chancing or suicide to turret within 10 seconds.  This did 3 things:  Took gold from us so we had even less chance, fed more kills to the enemy, and gave them a kda betterish then some of us who were actually trying to win.  During the entire match they said nothing in chat at all.

So in post game they had a kda around 7/20/0 while some of us who had been honestly trying to win were left with kda like 0/10/X.  This feeding player had one of the highest gold totals on our team because they had the majority of our kills and csed very well when not feeding.  Their build was legit, they needed as much power as possible to cleanup kills on us.

So I'm really curious how this system can differentiate this kind of feeder from someone who tries hard but dose badly or someone who starts out winning their lane with some early kills but then dies over and over to the fed enemy carry.  Even as a human watching the game unfold I'd have been unsure they were feeding if they hadn't announced it in pre-game chat.  They could have just been bad.
they do have access to "heatmaps" and know when and where every death happened. if you are 0/6 by 10 min in they know you fed every lane.

Not unless they have a more detailed internal heat-map than the one in the game stats.  The one in the game stats just shows where you died, not when, so said asshat would have died about twice in top, twice in bot, and a bunch in mid/river.  Not that unusual.

Depends what data they have internally that they don't give us access to anywhere.

They have WAY more internal data than we will ever see.

And you aren't entirely right I can reconstruct your last ranked game rather well (you were {{champion:50}} ) even with the limited information we can see.

For example {{champion:106}} (using him because he had a fairly high activity score) tried an early gank bot that didn't work giving a kill to cait followed by either a failed invade/gank mid where lulu got a kill. 3 min later he got a successful gank top. At 12 min he tried bot again and failed getting a 1 for 2 trade. At 15 he gets dived by Nassus while holding lane and dies top. Around 18 you and him catch lulu and rammus setting up for drag?/rotating bot and get them both but can't press an advantage because Nassus {{summoner:12}} bot and took out your lane.

In another couple min he picks up a kill on Ram (who if you look at just k/d looks like he is feeding but based on the time charts seems to just be having a bad day) followed by Nassus 1v2 ing him and J4 (really?). He then catches fiddle trying to push top. 5 min later you guys win a bid team fight mid and finally get the first mid tower followed by your first dragon of the game (you guys are coming back from way behind at this point). 

After this there was one skirmish then you caught them out a drag and got an ace and basically one off that.

So how did I do based  off of our woefully inadequate info?

> We'd rarely (if ever) ban a player for having one poor game--we may ban a player if it's super, extremely obvious they were intentional feeding in one game. We have a huge dataset at our disposal and can clearly see what's typical for a game, and what's one, two, three standard deviations for a game. We can also determine how you normally play in one game with a brand new champion first how you play in another game with a brand new champion to determine how much of an outlier one of the matches were.

I am having difficulty understand what, exactly, is being used to determine how the system would flag certain players and what data the system would consider. Does a games K/D/A fall under a standard normal curve? If so, is the outlier of one player compared to the other elements of their score? Using 7 deaths as a figurative mean and 2.5 units as a standard deviation for individual scores of Ranked Solo games on NA; you run into the problem of having certain roles (support) falling on the outlier range for games played going - say, 0-15-7. I'm assuming that Kills and Assists are compared as well, so does that mean this system looks at potential history of said player? Do you create individual Curves for each player, then decide for an outlier? Do you go off of previous reports? Repeat offenders? Or is there a bias against those who have been punished for other reasons? Do you look for certain qualities such as current rank, games of ranked played, or number of games played career?
How will the system account for death-related strategies ala proxy singed or tp/revive karthus? Or obscure situations like a cruel 4-person premade that lets you leona e in, then die by yourself?
That helps clarify.. Thanks ðŸ‘ðŸ‘
not perma banned... lets say ranked restrict for 5 - 10 games so they learn ruining games is not fun
person going 0-10 should play normals

Doesn't matter? Did you see Scarra's 19 loss streak? He did pretty poorly in quite a few of those games. He doesn't get reported so it's no problem; but what if you aren't Scarra and you have that kind of streak with a bunch reports?

OK..SCARRA is PROFESSIONAL his games arent because he had bad players or feeders. HIs team got outplayed. HIs team got focused properly and they Enemy was able to get more objectives. HIs 19 loss streak of amazing games that jsut ended up losing compared to the average silver/ gold/etc player that gets someone that goes 0/15/0 because they just ran up mid lane and died. there is a HUGE difference

And No..Professionals will not be taken out of the system..they will face punishments too if they act up..will they act up?..highly doubtful

=_= Pretty sure there is a misunderstanding here.

The issue isn't about pros or clear intentional feeding. The issue is "**What if someone happens to be on a bad streak?**"

Everybody is bound to lose a few games in a row. Considering that, imagine someone in ranked having a string of bad games where they died 6+ times per game and acquire intentional feeding reports that aren't justified. Can you safely say that these don't matter? Even if this poor sod's streak goes for ~10 games and he gets 3-4 reports per game? You think that's unlikely? Some people start raging and calling feeder when people are 0/2/0, even if there was nothing they could do about it.

This isn't to discredit the system, it is a legitimate question about how accurate it will be because shit happens and the last thing we need is a flood of posts/threads about ban appeals because of false positives.

I'm fairly certain that by large data set - Lyte is referring to things beyond KDA.

It's pretty obvious that you're trying to lose the game when you buy 6 boots. 

It's pretty obvious that you're intentionally feeding when you were playing a normal (but bad game) then start dying every 30s-1m. Even if you're playing badly - you won't be just running out of base and dying immediately for the rest of the game.

They also have chat logs. There is a lot to be said for one comment of "i'm gonna feed". The same 0-13 game is cast in a lot different light if you talk about feeding or afking than if you apologize for making mistakes.

Likewise, they have access to lobby and post game chat (just because it's not in the tribunal doesn't mean Lyte can't find it). If you were mad that someone took your preferred role and then went 0-13 without saying anything in game - that's different than saying "first time X" and going 0-13. 

They can also tell how many objectives you helped with, how much you warded and how often you were with your team (through assists). If you're the support and are 0-13-15 with several tower and dragon assists and many wards placed - that's different than the 0-13-3 mid with no wards and no objective assists.


Lastly, they have player statistics. If you have 1000 games that you tried in - few reports, around a 50% win rate - but you generally have a bad KDA. Let's say you average 1.5. You'll go something like 5-10-10 in a game. Now you have a 0-15-1 game. That's pretty out of the ordinary for you. If they notice weird things in the other categories I mentioned - then it's probably a case of feeding. But that's just one case - they won't ban you for doing it once. 

Now, let's assume you have 1000 games, but your performance is really up and down. Some of the time you have great 20-3-6 games, some times you have 0-12 games. Let's also say that during those 0-12 games, you averaged a high number of reports and had very unusual or flat out troll (6 tears, 6 boots, etc) builds. Now let's say you go 0-15-1 in a game. This is more likely intentionally feeding. And since your account seems to have a history of it - you're probably going to get banned quicker. 

TL; DR

Lyte and the player behavior team have access to EVERYTHING that happens in game and in pre and post game chat. If you can tell the difference between an intentional feeder and someone having a bad game - they can too. They are not just using one stat or looking at one game - they have all the data on you that you can imagine. I doubt there will be many of false positives in this - especially during the first wave.

>I doubt there will be many of false positives in this - especially during the first wave.

Even a single false-positive would be waay too much, if they cannot be 100%sure noone will be wrongly accused they should not implement it.

Edit: I have played more than 3000games of LoL and never met anyone i would accuse of intentional feeding, i really doubt thereÂ´s anyone doing it for "fun" or anything, maybe someone will go and feed when tilting or when he gets harrassed too much - but should sth. like that be banworthy? in my opinion...no, not at all. 
So creating an automized punishment system for this issue is in my opinion only hitting the wrong people and doesnÂ´t do anything about the root-causes of the behaviour. IÂ´m highly sceptic about it and I think itÂ´s totally a step in the wrong direction if someone wants to create a better community. ItÂ´s more like creating a terror-regime.

Dude, I have some bad news for you.

This is the real world.

Manually reviewing every case (*cough cough* the justice system *cough cough*) doesn't have a 100% success rate. 

They will get as close as they can, but of course people will occassionally be incorrectly flagged as intentionally feeding. When this happens - they will send a support ticket and Riot will look at it and give them access to their account back. 

People do stupid stuff - I could imagine someone playing with friends who are a much higher level and doing poorly and saying stuff like "i'm gonna feed", "gg feeding", etc as a joke. Of course, the people reviewing these cases and the automatic systems can't tell it's sarcasm. There was a guy who got banned because he always talked shit about himself - once he told Riot that and they more carefully reviewed his logs - it was clear that he wasn't actually toxic. 

They should implement it. If it has a 99.95% success rate - they will have removed tons of terrible people from the community while still giving themselves a chance to redeem themselves and their accounts by improving and changing their behavior. 

Getting your account banned for a few days on accident - when it happens to maybe 10? people per server - when they were doing things that triggered the system and look bad out of context is the price we pay for not having to deal with legitimate intentional feeders. Riot will fix their mistakes and anyone who should not have been banned will have their ban reversed.

Since I edited the same time you answered...

I have played more than 3000games of LoL and never met anyone i would accuse of intentional feeding, i really doubt thereÂ´s anyone doing it for "fun" or anything, maybe someone will go and feed when tilting or when he gets harrassed too much - but should sth. like that be banworthy? in my opinion...no, not at all.
So creating an automized punishment system for this issue is in my opinion only hitting the wrong people and doesnÂ´t do anything about the root-causes of the behaviour. IÂ´m highly sceptic about it and I think itÂ´s totally a step in the wrong direction if someone wants to create a better community. ItÂ´s more like creating a terror-regime.

I've had people intetionally feed.

It's not overly common, but usually when someone is upset about something.

I once had a game where the enemy Sej was intentionally feeding (just running at us everytime she respawned and not attacking, just dying) and our top laner (Jax I think) was also intentionally feeding (doing the same thing to them). It was battle of who could feed better.


It does happen and it's not excusable and is ban worthy in my opinion. I've seen perfectly winable games go from having a disadvantage (someone is behind in lane) to being completely thrown away (because that person now fed 10+ kills to the carry). It's not intentionally feeding to just be bad - but it is intentional if you run straight at them again and again with the intent to die. 

Since this is a team game you should never feed on purpose. So what if you're doing poorly - so what if you're mad? AFKing is better than feeding (because it's not putting the other team farther ahead) and people are always up in arms about that.

I don't see how this is a terror regime. It's part of the summoner's code to continue to help your team for the whole game "so don't leave the game or go AFK! Encourage players who are having trouble, and congratulate those who are playing well. And most of all, if you're having a bad game don't take it out on your team!"

They are 100% right to punish players for this behavior. And in the cases of this I've seen, it's the TOXIC ASSHOLE that's doing it. It's not the guy who was quiet, just having a bad game that was harrassed and now decides "fuck you all I'm going to feed" - It's the guy who's been complaining about everything all game - saying his team sucks - berating other people and then decided that he hates his team so much he wants them to lose. 

Again - it's never okay to intentionally feed. If you are doing it - you should be banned. If you continue to do it - you should be permanently banned.

>And in the cases of this I've seen, it's the TOXIC ASSHOLE that's doing it. It's not the guy who was quiet, just having a bad game that was harrassed and now decides "fuck you all I'm going to feed"

So then...ban and punish him for being toxic, itÂ´s a lot easier to track down someone using inappropriate language than it is to decide if someone is feeding on purpose out of the gamelogs. No need for a further system that might aswell catch innocent players as colateral damage.

Why not have both?

inappropriate language seems like a much less severe action than purposefully ruining a game. 

You can be a total tool to a person without being racist or a homophobe and probably not get banned for it. It's also easy enough to ping spam and things like sarcasm and context are never readable from the chat log.

Example:
Akali is doing great and getting tons of multikills and doing sick out plays.

I say stuff like "man, this akali", "gg", "gj", "amazing", "teach me master" - I'm being a really positive player.

Now, akali is doing terribly - diving in and dying, failing to secure kills, making really stupid mistakes (missing Q/R)

I say stuff like "man, this akali", "gg", "gj", "amazing", "teach me master" - I'm being a sarcastic dickwad.

The current chat banning system flags racism, homophobia, threats and other "severe" language. It won't catch just being an asshole as long as you avoid cussing and slurs. 

Intentionally feeding (it is very obvious when it's intentional and when it's not) is never a grey area. It's not like - well - in this context it was okay that he fed intentionally because he was just trying to get the game over sooner. No. That's not how this works. 

I expect the false positive rate to be stupidly low because of how obvious the "intentional" part is. If someone does manage to trip it on accident though (there are millions and millions of players) I'm fine with that as long as the misunderstanding gets resolved.

A bad streak isnt grounds for punishment..it just means you got Bested by your enemy and lost.

The system wont crack down on games that are 6+ with reports it looks into other things. Kills/assists if any, what Champion,  What role, Where they died, etc etc. The new match history system is wonderful cause it records WHERE you died and where you got kills.

Yes, of course I realize it doesn't just ban from reports and looks at other factors.

The important thing here still remains, how do we deal with the inevitable false positives? This is a system that can permaban people. Having a rough idea of the criteria is kind of a big deal since at the end of the day, this is a system, not a human potentially handing out bans. A system isn't going to be able to tell the difference between someone genuinely trying and someone intentionally feeding if the deciding factor is chat log for example.

If you go 0/10/7 and get reported by 3 teammates even though 6 of your deaths prevent theirs, how does the system discern this? Can it? Like I said, shit happens. It isn't a matter of is the system perfect or we don't believe this thing is good. We just want to know that at the very least, permabans aren't going to be handed out without a human review at least.

One of the reasons this test took awhile to prepare was because we were looking at dozens of variables to determine what would be a good identifier of an intentional feeder versus a player just having a bad game.

Because we're starting conservatively, we'll be aiming the tests at higher severity cases of intentional feeding first and then reviewing if there were any false positives. Once we're confident in this initial test, we'll expand the tests to include more nuanced forms of intentional feeding.

So, for the first test, because we're being more conservative with the net, super confident in its accuracy.

There are many trolls who are too smart to feed intentionally.

Every time someone is mad about champ select I see them "try something unconventional" and "accidentally" make just enough mistakes to cause a loss.

Most of the time these people ADMIT that they aren't trying to win, but they seem immune to punishment. Will something ever be done about people who troll "subtly" in Ranked Solo Queue?

Plot twist!

What if those players were actually trying to win, and just didn't pick a standard LCS champion for their role?

What if the players made actual mistakes, and were not intentionally throwing the game?

IMO this is the biggest problem with League: If what you're playing wasn't picked in LCS in the last month, everyone thinks you're a troll.

> Most of the time these people ADMIT that they aren't trying to win, but they seem immune to punishment.

I think GP is talking mostly about people who, for example, are forced to support and lock in Pantheon while saying in chat "lol, shoulda let me top now I'm gona feed."  Yes, maybe their trying to win but it's hard to discount that their 0/10 kda and statement of intent might be related.

I admit, I really am scared. I've had some bad games in normals that were just...well, bad. I never, EVER intentionally feed. I do everything I can NOT to feed. But I was accused of feeding once and I'm scared of what could happen if people just get mad and report you for feeding anyways. I'm talking about games where you just had a lot of trouble in lane and it felt like there was nothing you could do. You don't go into lane to feed, but its like the enemy is so fed that even sitting under your tower results in a kill for them. THAT sort of bad game. I think we've all had at least one.

Those games I'm scared of. I usually report for verbal abuse but rarely for feeding because I know sometimes you just have a bad game. I don't know how this will be seen from the point of view of the screeners though.
im sure the random bad game is not going to get you suspended. It is likely looking for a string of games where a certain ratio or score occurs.

I think the biggest question has already been addressed...

Some games are horrendous .. And when those occur, a teammate may say.. Report for intentional feeding.. There is a difference between  having a bad game and going 0/10/7 and a teammate starting out 0/0/7, having enough and running straight down mid into turret/enemy team without launching an offensive just to feed kills.

I believe since the system is being set up as a test, we should know the parameters in which can be considered a ban-able offense.

IMO, intentional feeding is much harder to judge on a non human level then verbal vulgarity or use of the "ism's". It appears as if there would be a LARGER room for error.
I would be most severely disappointed and shocked if permanent bans were assigned from a system, and not human hands.

As would I...

Intentional feeding as per the tribunal system as I understand it.. That say.. Handful of bad games, sprinkled with reports, can be overlooked as just that.. Bad games (in which the reports don't add up).

Take into account a system that marks or notes when your K/D ratio is at a certain area, mind you, it could be a totally different ball game.

Let's also consider this...
Does anyone actually believe that there are people who run down middle, handing team kills, game in and game out.. Logs on for say 5 games a day, every day and consistently goes 0/28/0? I don't think that a person who is being toxic and/or spiteful and feeds kills when the game/team/teammate rubs them the wrong way can be tracked easily except by human feedback to humans.

I have also seen instances where a person started off poorly, and got so badgered by teammates that they just stop caring and stop trying.. Who is to fault in that case?

Too many variables.. As opposed to foul, vulgar, racist, "ism" language.

Did the player use any skills in the 10 seconds prior to his death, how many different inputs are coming in and what zone are they usually in, how frequent are those kind of behaviors in said player's games, did he use chat, did he use certain keywords, did he DC, did he ever sell items to buy multiple zeals. There are quite a few variables that can be ispected to see if it's a terrible game or a feeder.

You are correct.. Out of all the games I've played recently, there is only 1 instance of intentional feeding I've seen.. The jungler got into an argument with the ADC... Said I am done.. The thing is...
The rest of the team was doing pretty well.. Then came team fight time and I noticed him charge straight down mid.. Death after death.. I checked his inventory.. Full of the same boots..
I tried to get him back.. Come on man.. I know you two got your differences, but let's just win this and move on...
ADC said it was already too late, and the jungler kept up his mid charge..


Smh.. What a waste of time

I want to know how much feeding is a red flag. I assume it's probably taken over multiple games rather than one, so a really bad game won't put you at risk. I played Fiddlesticks for the first time today, and when I was at 1/7/7 both the top and mid laner were being extremely toxic and threatening to report me for feeding (they probably did report). I know that is too little to get a warning/ban, but there will be a day when I do far worse.

if they were toxic..i feel bad for you and them..you didnt deserve hopefuly and they deserve to be punished for not helping you get back from a death or help you improve after the fact.
If it was your first time playing Fiddlesticks..why didnt you practice in bots?..THat what bots were implemented for..To practice upon..to improve skills. Try to builds etc etc

It was not ranked, and bots do not do the game justice if you already know how to play. Maybe for you Normal games are the real deal, but for me it is practice mode. And it wasn't me being bad at Fiddles that caused the deaths if you have to know, it was 3 disconnects.

That is another Thing they HAVE HAVE HAVE HAVE HAVE TO take into account..DC related deaths.
I was hoping since they have the "if you DC you run towards your base" system in place. they should add a bit to it. like if you DC you should either be immune to everything. to instantly go to base..no running or something.. or you become untargetable and cant move for like 15sec upon reconnection and actually in game not on loading screen.

And yes normals are practice for people. I Agree with you on that. You cant know trully how to play if you cant play against humans.
Bots is mainly for Practice on new champs/ new builds. Or if you are THAT bad,,then yes to practice playing the game.
I believe you also get something crazy like 1000 armour and magic resist right on or soon after DC, and it persists until the loading screen is finished and you are in control again.

It is after, but it's not very soon, and you're just standing there or continuing an action until then. More than once I've been set to autoattack an opponent when I dc, and it makes me follow them across the map to my death (or set autowalking to a hot zone). The resistance takes a considerable amount of time to set in so people can't abuse it and dc on purpose when caught out of position.

http://matchhistory.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/#match-history/NA1/208717585

**TankHo had a** great **match with a** Katarina and posted but subsequently deleted the match history of a generous and kind non-**toxic player**. **@Lyte should** look, I'm sure he'll be impressed and **certainly** not **impose a permanent ban due to** how impressive **his** last 4 months of not once in **hundreds of games** ever **building specifically to feed 30-60 times.**

Do you know whats the biggest joke in league of legends justice? When the mid laner is a 1/12 ...i dunno lets say leblanc, and there is a 10/1 for ex, tristana bot lane, and she says something like lb stop feeding, then leblanc reports her for "verbal abuse" and "offensive behaviour" even tho she and her feeding is the reason of the behaviour in the first place. So justice = feeder who ruined game is free 2 go, pro adc with 10/1 who did his best to carry an almost unwinable game gets banned or chat blocked. Where is the justice in that? If any chatblock the 1/12 and give the 10/1 a helpful honnor badge. I mean i know the people saying the game is for fun, but if you feel like being a 1/12 mid laner who ruins the game for a 10/1 pro is fun.... then there is no place for you in ranked, go back to normals or arams

This sistem is a shit.Fcking polish kids come in game and make 0/20 score and they don't get ban,but if you say something wrongh you get ban 14 days or 9999 Chat restriction.This is how riot work.{{item:3070}}

haha nice joke riot 
Last match bot feeded like damn bloody hell (like my rest 213864287643872134 games)
After couple of matches I get in low priority because other people feed gg riot I keep my money
I like the game i like the way how champion works but u guys are rly bad at teambalancing.
Last match 22 team deaths in 2o min gg
Most of my matches are going like this

Silver V: I was destroyed by someone, 0/20/3, a few months ago.  My entire team reported me for feeding.  A few minutes later I got a message from a challenger account saying that he was sorry for targeting me on his smurf account and he felt bad that my whole team was mad at me for dying to him.  I probably would have been perma-banned by this Nazi style autoban system because someone decided they wanted to be a big badass against someone who was way beneath his skill level.  Autobanning on this level is complete crap.
